p: Sorbitol is another example of an excipient that causes gastrointestinal disorders, such as abdominal pain, swelling, flatulence, vomiting and osmotic diarrhoea. Because sorbitol is metabolized to fructose, it should be avoided on children with fructose intolerance and hypoglycaemia. In isolated cases it can cause liver damage leading to coma and even death [ 28, 29, 30].
